results.title: Gastro-intestinal cancer: problem of early diagnosis
results.brief_description: A survey of cancer reviewing salient points in diagnosis and stressing importance of early discovery and treatment in lowering mortality figures. The film was produced for use by general practitioners, residents, particularly of internal medicine, interns and medical students in their clinical years.

results.title: Gaston's recital = Le Violon de Gaston
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Paul Larose, Laurence Pare and Andre Melancon
results.brief_description: This short dramatic film about a young boy torn between conflicting loyalties is resolved with humor and wisdom. Sunday, two o’clock, is zero hour for Gaston. He must be in two places at once: performing at a music recital and playing hockey with his teammates. The game is won, and Gaston plays his piece in his hockey outfit. The well-developed script touches on obedience, loyalty, and the art of compromise. Cast: Mireille Bienvenu, Claude Jolicoeur, Monique Larocque, Andre Poirier.

results.title: Gaslight
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Hornblow and George Cukor
results.brief_description: Ingrid Bergman plays Paula, a susceptible and romantic minded young woman who marries Gregory Anton (Charles Boyer), whose suave manner conceals his murderous intentions and an obsession with finding precious jewels hidden in her London home. She becomes his helpless victim as he slowly drives her to the brink of insanity.

results.title: Gas: the magic flame
results.brief_description: Use of gas for domestic purposes and in heavy industry; heating, cooking and hot water systems; variety of uses in industry, gas flame used for fusing television tubes, glass blowing, mass producing moulded glassware and light globes. In heavy industry gas heat is used in smelters at steelworks, the manufacture of hot water systems, wall boards and lead shot. Standards of safety are maintained by the Australian Gas Association.

results.title: Gas: natural energy
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson Film Productions, Australian Gas Light Company and Michael Robertson
results.brief_description: An animated film which utilises felt-tipped pens and examines the pace of change, and points out that half of all the energy consumed by society has been used in the past fifty years. Narrated by Reginald Glanvill, with animation by Film Graphics P/L.

results.title: Gas! or It became necessary to destroy the world in order to save it
results.creator_credit: San Jacinto Productions and Roger Corman
results.brief_description: When the military authorities release a noxious substance that causes “death from instant old age” in everyone over twenty-five, the youth of America are left to their own devices to invent a new world order. This black, totally zany film is one of Roger Corman’s triumphs as it captures a blend of acid rock, far-out humour and revolutionary politicking in the true spirit of the sixties and the Love Generation. Stars Robert Corff, Elaine Giftos, Ben Vereen and Cindy Williams and features music performed by Country Joe and the Fish.

results.title: Gas welding
results.brief_description: This film introduces gas welding step by step. The nine sections of the film deal with all stages of welding. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Gas turbine goes to sea
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Phillip Armitage
results.brief_description: Records the installation of the first marine gas turbine for an ocean-going vessel. Draws attention to the length of time taken for installation - three months, and the importance of further tests, when it is at sea. Concludes by pointing out that it will be a long time before the gas turbine takes it place with the steam engine and diesel engine, but the first steps have been taken.

results.title: Gas from Gippsland
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Roy A. Driver
results.brief_description: Describes the construction of the Brown Coal Gasification Plant at Morwell in Victoria’s Latrobe Valley. The Plant is designed to use the Lurgi High Pressure Gasification process and will be immediately capable of delivering 15 million cubic feet daily. Shows the laying of the 103 mile gas pipe-line to Melbourne and the official opening of the Plant by HRH the Duke of Edinburgh in December 1956.
